snippet: Gulf leaders, led by King Salman of Saudi Arabia, are searching for ways to ensure their security in an era when they might not be able to rely on the United States.
abstract: King Salman of Saudi Arabia and leaders of other Gulf Cooperation Council countries are becoming more public in their expressions of mistrust and displeasure with Obama administration's Middle East policies, particularly deal on Iran's nuclear program; disentangling themselves from decades of military cooperation with United States and Britain will be slow process as they have become dependent on US for security.
lead_paragraph: Gulf leaders, led by King Salman of Saudi Arabia, are searching for ways to ensure their security in an era when they might not be able to rely on the United States.

headline.main: Despite Displeasure With U.S., Saudis Face Long Dependency
headline.print_headline: Despite Displeasure With U.S., Saudis Face Long Dependency

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
